title: Ticket #3302: condor_q -analyze takes a long time in chtc pool
description:
condor_q -analyze always contacts the NEGOTIATOR to get user-priorities. This takes a very long time in CHTC (5 min?). Todd thinks this is a regression and that the NEGOTIATOR used to respond to userprio requests asynchronously.

Also, the CMS jobs use a Requirements expression that condor_q -analyze doesn't deal with very well. It ends up treating the meat of the expression - a clause with dozens of parens and many sub-clauses as a single item.
remarks:
2012-Dec-11 16:40:34 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070902 to v070903 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2012-Dec-21 12:09:20 by sfiligoi:
Can we also have an option to NOT contact the negotiator at all?

More often than not one wants to know if the job would match at all... the fact that other users may have a higher priority is a second level optimization.

While the result it would be partial, the difference in speed would be well worth the compromise.

2013-Jan-22 10:54:51 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070903 to v070904 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2013-Mar-05 11:07:03 by johnkn:
The default for condor_q -analyze and -better-analyze is now to NOT contact the Negotiator. This means that user priority is not part of analysis.

In order to have user prio be part of analysis, use the -analyze:priority or -better-analyze:priority. With this option enabled, the negotiator is contacted to fetch user priorities and user priorities are considered during analysis.

2013-Mar-11 15:03:22 by tannenba:
See also related ticket #3535.
check_ins:

2013-Jan-11 11:17   Check-in [34615]: do condor_q -analyze without considering user priorities unless -analyze:priority is specified #3302 Includes some pruning of obsolete code and cleanup of argument parsing as well. ===VersionHistory:Pending=== (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
2012-Nov-02 16:27   Check-in [33972]: add -userprios argument to condor_q for use with -analyze, part of #3302 you can supply a text file containing user/submitter priorities (i.e. the output of condor_userprio -long), rather than query the negotiator for that information. Also changed the parsing of -jobads to accept as input the output [...] (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
creator: johnkn
